Activity: Catch up with emails and have a short meeting with the art team to discuss progress and any challenges.

Continue working on environment concepts. Focus on one specific location and develop it in more detail. Consider the gameplay possibilities and how the environment can be used to create interesting scenarios.
Research and gather reference images for the environment. Look for real-world locations that are similar to the game's setting. Study the architecture, vegetation, and lighting of these locations.
Take a break. Play some video games for inspiration. Pay attention to the environment design and how it contributes to the gameplay experience.
Lunch time with @LVDN-1 to discuss about the actual level design and how the visual design can support it.
Begin sketching prop designs. Start with a list of props that will be needed for the game. Consider the function and purpose of each prop, and how it will fit into the game's world.
Sketch a variety of prop designs. Experiment with different shapes, sizes, and materials. Try to create props that are visually interesting and believable.
Select the most promising prop designs and begin developing them in more detail. Add more details to the props, such as textures, wear and tear, and unique features.
Daily wrap-up. Organize files and notes. Make a to-do list for tomorrow.
